document.title: Academic Standards for Personal Finance Grades K-12

E22417299FD8470780B2B9066653DE11.description:
Explain why lenders must provide
borrowers with certain
information (e.g., interest rates,
annual percentage rates, fees,
terms, conditions).

5E016BBA6D82452990456DE33B773E1C.description:
Explain why potential borrowers
could reach different conclusions
about the use of credit, including
how much debt constitutes
overborrowing.

BB2EF235A6F44FE6A5D3F2DB48B22300.description:
Analyze factors that influence the
total cost of paying with credit,
including interest rates, fees,
repayment period, and source of
credit.

A6209B8D511A4F4282423B485E4DFA46.description:
Summarize the differences
between credit cards and debit
cards.

2890629F5E3748D89EB8CB4C9740CD36.description:
Discuss various forms of credit and
their uses (e.g., credit cards, home
loans, auto loans, student loans).

404EE910DB87477D9E3641ED78714EE5.description:
Explain how credit is established
and tracked over time for an
individual.

08CF6105B74A44529220B07921D28A58.description:
Describe strategies people can use
to protect their personally
identifiable information.

2A365096948B4CBC8F645B3F4F97B15E.description:
Describe how insurance works by
pooling the premiums of many
policyholders in order to pay for
claims.

E322A88E98AA435EAF4EF5B622474ADE.description:
Defend decisions to purchase or
forgo insurance, extended
warranties, and service contracts.

926F443BD9594A228635B0C1907B902F.description:
Describe factors that impact the
amount an individual can expect
to pay for insurance (e.g.,
coverage types and amounts, age,
location, driving record).

F5A5D9F6D38B48288D8F8AE9F9954F0F.description:
Compare various types of
insurance and what is typically
covered by each.

098A547B4F81448EA05740BD695B9823.description:
Describe how people manage the
risk of financial loss through risk
avoidance, reduction, retention,
and transfer.

989FF31D47124CF1AB51E6E21876ED1B.description:
Provide examples of financial risks
people face (e.g., losing a job,
needing to replace damaged
property, paying medical
expenses).

D41065723434423693F7064271F85A83.description:
Assess the impact of values and
attitudes, including tolerance for
risk, on saving and investing
decisions.

6CFF0AC1D841474185AB45ECC9B7B86F.description:
Describe how people make money
through investing (e.g., buying low
and selling high, earning
dividends, buy and hold).

1FFA2AD4BEA5435D8F4FDC4179FCA85C.description:
Identify factors influencing
investment planning (e.g., age,
income, debt, assets, goals, family
size, risk tolerance).

FC255BAAC1A2478C978B1AA981B231F5.description:
Identify publicly traded
companies, the goods and services
they produce, and their current
stock prices.

61304548A5A64D52ABDB6F0CA589C0BB.description:
Describe similarities and
differences between saving and
investing.

EDAE8AFB7ACF42FE9E21E93A3BE64387.description:
Use different methods and tools
to calculate the growth in savings
given various scenarios (e.g.,
simple versus compound interest,
starting age, years to save, and
interest rates).

7B1827F63DAB4A90954DA36822874602.description:
Describe the process of creating,
implementing, and adapting a
personal savings plan.

0D510C48DE5A4884BD730445601B227A.description:
Explain the change in value over
time of various assets.

90A1B4F3A7B5481B9480724E825F278F.description:
Describe ways people support
charitable organizations by
donating money, items, and time.

0048F502904945D1A37A2B8DDCC42D38.description:
Calculate the sales tax for various
types of purchases.

47B2C5E5195B4AD986AC61F37B029D52.description:
Describe the advantages and
disadvantages of using various
payment methods (e.g., cash,
checks, gift cards, debit cards,
credit cards, mobile payments).

7FFE10E8275145908CA86C61029C7CD8.description:
Explain the components of a
personal budget (e.g., income,
expenses, planned savings) and
how budgeting can help people
achieve their financial goals.

028D558A1B844C17B8E95C7A60FC50DA.description:
Compare ways people organize
and track their spending and
income.

EFA1079A27AC46DEB1A0E21F43382842.description:
Apply mathematical skills to assess
the impact of various ways
retailers express prices (e.g.,
coupons, discounts, unit price).

05AB030F30DB411EB7F0F4E44A40EFE0.description:
Demonstrate making an informed
purchase decision by evaluating
price, product claims, and
information from a variety of
sources.

49E839EB6E814FBD97011500EAA977F5.description:
Interpret a pay statement and
explain the relationship between
gross pay, net pay, and payroll
deductions.

8E62D7EE44F4481488F9D6D3C39EDEA3.description:
Explain factors that may impact a
person's future income and
employment status, including
changes in technology, demand
for workers, and the cost of postsecondary education.

DBCB863FE4E84CAD99DD21D30D0DCE82.description:
Compare ways people pay for
education and training, including
scholarships, grants, savings,
military service, apprenticeships,
and loans.

1CA493898CCC456F8CD5A63A33E2D81A.description:
Analyze connections between the
amount individuals might earn in
various careers and the education
or training that is required.

950A94B5ACA04FDBBDD99798E6ADFF0A.description:
Compare compensation methods,
including hourly wage, salary,
commission, tips, and piecework.

B5F67CC1653145448E659EB03666745B.description:
Describe information people
document and track for their
personal finances.

735051456EDB4F609AFDE3521BD50EA5.description:
Identify personal information
needed to establish a financial
account.

69529B046DF64298A50CCC30793EF5F5.description:
Describe important financial
conversations people have and
with whom they have them.

83142AF77B054A129AA615BEA2446A01.description:
Describe behavioral biases that
can affect financial decisions.

C16F060DFCE8410CBB80B3793FFBF31D.description:
Analyze how people differ in their
attitudes toward money.

70BE8DD3C9784289BC09ADBC6B83FF51.description:
Explain why the opportunity cost
of a decision might differ from one
person or situation to another.

111918EDAD1947AEA9240671749AD9A1.description:
Compare short-, intermediate-,
and long-term financial goals.

9D120EAE001E451AB46CBE2A49EBBAD4.description:
Financial goal
setting and
decision making
